question_content: Which additional field must be completed before the order can be processed?

choice.d: Name

question_content: Where should the requested report be faxed?

choice.d: That information has not yet been entered on the form.

question_content: A test is being conducted on the turbine generator module (Location 10). What is the longest time a worker without hearing protection can stay in this module without exceeding the exposure time permitted?

choice.d: 110 minutes

question_content: An area that is normally safe to work an 8-hour shift without hearing protection has a malfunctioning piece of equipment and is slightly louder than normal. The safety coordinator informs workers in the area that they must wear hearing protection today. In which of the following areas is the malfunctioning equipment located?

choice.d: Location 14

question_content: You are asked to create a graphic that would make it easy to quickly tell which locations require that ear protection be worn after 12 hours of exposure with the understanding that the sound level limit is 87. Would the proposed new graphic accomplish this purpose?
answer_content: “Yes, because ordering from lowest sound level to highest sound level makes it easy to use the exposure graph to see what time is permitted.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: Yes, because ordering from lowest sound level to highest sound level makes it easy to use the exposure graph to see what time is permitted.

choice.b: Yes, because the bar graph identifies the exposure time permitted without the use of hearing protection.

choice.c: No, because ordering from lowest sound level to highest sound level makes it hard to use the exposure graph to see what time is permitted.

choice.d: No, because the bar graph does not display sound levels for each location.

question_content: How many locations have permitted exposure times less than 1 hour without hearing protection?
A sound meter records 95 dBA in a different location in the plant. What exposure time without hearing protection would be permitted in that location?

choice.d: There is not enough information available to answer the question

question_content: What is the approximate current flow rate, in gpm, based on the digital dashboard reading?
You receive a text alert that you must fertilize 14 more acres in the next hour before it begins to rain. What should you do?
answer_content: “Increase speed to approximately 7.1 mph to cover the additional acres in one hour.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: Maintain current speed because you will be able to cover the additional acres in one hour.

choice.b: Increase the engine speed to approximately 2,700 rpm to cover the additional acres in one hour.

choice.c: Increase speed to approximately 7.1 mph to cover the additional acres in one hour.

choice.d: Increase to second gear to cover the additional acres in one hour.

question_content: What is the area rate of coverage (acre/hour) when operating at 8.0 mph?
The value for area rate of coverage (acre/hour) compared to speed (mph) is approximately:
answer_content: “twice as large.” is the correct answer.

choice.d: one-fourth as large.

question_content: Suppose that shifting into third gear decreased the engine speed (rpm) while increasing the tractor speed (mph). What would be the effect of this change?
answer_content: “Area rate would increase and flow rate would decrease.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: Both area rate and flow rate would increase.

choice.b: Area rate would increase and flow rate would decrease.

choice.c: Area rate would decrease and flow rate would increase.

choice.d: Both area rate and flow rate would decrease.

question_content: Most of Juan's calls were in which category?
answer_content: The correct is A, Incoming completed sale.

choice.d: Outgoing cold call

question_content: You need to create a graphic that will allow management to know if representatives hit target percentages for each call type. The target percentages are known to management. Which of the proposed charts best serves that purpose?
answer_content: “Chart B, because it makes it easy to compare the percentages for each category to a standard value.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: Chart A, because it places all representatives in one graphic.

choice.b: Chart A, because it makes it easy to compare the percentages for each category to a standard value.

choice.c: Chart B, because it places all representatives in one graphic.

choice.d: Chart B, because it makes it easy to compare the percentages for each category to a standard value.

question_content: Which representative had the highest percentage of outgoing completed sales calls?

choice.d: Malik

question_content: A representative who has more than 15% of calls defined as nonbusiness will need to provide written explanation to the supervisor. Which representative, if any, needs to provide written explanation to the supervisor?

choice.d: None of the representatives

question_content: What was the amount of the gas bill in November?
Which utility varied the most throughout the year, and approximately what were the highest and lowest levels?

choice.d: Gas; $210 and $20

question_content: What trend exists for the gas bill during the year?
answer_content: “Decreases and then increases during the year” is the correct answer.

choice.c: Decreases and then increases during the year

choice.d: Increases and then decreases during the year

question_content: An electrical appliance malfunction in one month caused it to use more electricity. In which month did the appliance most likely malfunction, and in which month was it most likely repaired?
answer_content: “June, and it was repaired during August.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: June, and it was repaired during August.

choice.b: June, and it was repaired during September.

choice.c: July, and it was repaired during September.

choice.d: July, and it was repaired during October.

question_content: Which of the following is a false statement based on the data?
answer_content: “The difference between the gas and electric bills in February is double the difference between those bills in March.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: The difference between the gas and electric bills in February is double the difference between those bills in March.

choice.b: The largest difference between the gas and electric bills occurred in July.

choice.c: The smallest difference between the gas and electric bills occurred in April.

choice.d: The highest value of both the gas and electric bills was between $200 and $250.

question_content: The machine shop receives a contract for a job with a tolerance grade of 10 and a 2-inch nominal size hole that must be drilled. According to the table and chart, what is the lowest standard tolerance, in thousandths of an inch, for this operation?
What is the range of tolerance grades for reaming?
answer_content: “Tolerance grades 6 through 10” is the correct answer.

choice.d: Tolerance grades 6 through 11

question_content: A machinist will use a 4.5 inch nominal size boring bit that requires tolerances of 1.4 thousandths of an inch. Should a diamond boring bit be used?
answer_content: “Yes, because a diamond boring bit will be within the tolerance requested.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: No, because a diamond boring bit is not within the tolerance requested.

choice.b: No, because switching to a diamond boring bit will take too long.

choice.c: Yes, because a diamond boring bit will be within the tolerance requested.

choice.d: Yes, because a diamond boring bit is close to the tolerance requested.

question_content: For a process with a tolerance grade of 9, when the nominal size doubles from 2 inches to 4 inches, the tolerance:
answer_content: “increases; but by less than double.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: increases; but by less than double.

choice.c: increases; but by greater than double.

choice.d: may increase or decrease depending on which machining operation is done.

question_content: Which of the following should be the tolerance, in thousandths of an inch, for an object with a nominal size of 205 inches with a tolerance grade of 10?
Approximately how many students in the 22 through 25 age group were enrolled in 2006?
What has happened to the enrollment of students in the 20 through 21 age group over the time period?
answer_content: “Increased and then decreased” is the correct answer.

choice.d: Decreased and then increased

question_content: In 2016, about how many more students ages 17 through 19 were enrolled than students over age 25?
You are asked to make a graph that best compares the changes in enrollment by age group over time. Which of these graphs best meets your goal?
answer_content: “” is the correct answer.

question_content: What is the appropriate span for a 30 psf load using 2×8 boards with a joist spacing of 16 inches?
answer_content: “12 feet 1 inch” is the correct answer.

choice.d: 13 feet 11 inches

question_content: As the spacing between joists increases, the maximum span for any board size:

choice.d: decreases and then increases.

question_content: How many hours of downtime did the curing department have on Tuesday?
Which department had the largest increase in downtime from one day to the next and when?
answer_content: “Curing department, from Thursday to Friday” is the correct answer.

choice.a: Mixing department, from Monday to Tuesday

choice.b: Mixing department, from Tuesday to Wednesday

choice.c: Curing department, from Monday to Tuesday

choice.d: Curing department, from Thursday to Friday

question_content: Based on the table, one advantage to using 2×10 boards rather than 2×8 boards is that:
answer_content: “at a given load, the 2×10 boards can support a greater span.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: at a given load, the 2×10 boards can support a smaller span.

choice.b: at a given load, the 2×10 boards can support a greater span.

choice.c: at a given spacing, the 2×10 boards require less construction time.

choice.d: at a given spacing, the 2×10 boards require less construction cost.

question_content: The load requirement in your plans is 50 psf at a joist spacing of 16 inches. If the room is 14 feet 6 inches long by 10 feet 2 inches wide, would 2×8 boards be appropriate?
answer_content: “No, because 2×8 boards can support only the width of the room.” is the correct answer.

choice.a: Yes, because 2×8 boards can support the width of the room.

choice.b: Yes, because 2×8 boards can support the width and length of the room.

choice.c: No, because 2×8 boards can support only the width of the room.

choice.d: No, because the 2×8 boards can support neither the width nor length of the room.

question_content: You have been directed to reduce the costs that make up the first 75% of monthly expenditures. Which expenditures should you target?
answer_content: “HVAC, refrigeration, and lights only” is the correct answer.

choice.d: HVAC, refrigeration, and lights only

question_content: Approximately how much more is spent on computers than on copiers per month?
What is the part number for a 6'' elbow connector?
Working upward from the stove, the worker just installed K2654. What part should be installed next?
During which phase were no faults introduced?

choice.d: Phase 4

question_content: What is the approximate percentage of observed faults during all four phases that were design faults?
Which type of fault, if any, had most of its faults observed during the same phase that the faults were introduced?

choice.d: None of the faults

question_content: After logic faults were introduced, how did the observed percentage of logic faults change as the project moved from Phase 1 through Phase 4?
answer_content: “Increased and then decreased” is the correct answer.

choice.d: Decreased and then increased

question_content: The marketing department requested a price quote from SelfCare magazine because it has the largest number of readers with an age midpoint near the age midpoint for an NC Supplement product. Which product is most likely to be advertised in SelfCare?

choice.d: Woman's Stress-Less

choice.c: Switch the ad to SelfCare because, based on the focus group, it has strong sales at an appropriate age.

choice.d: Cancel the ad until another focus group determines what the actual target consumer age should be for Natural Beauty Secret.

question_content: A customer makes a purchase of $285 and uses a MCVS credit card. What percent will the bank charge the store?

The instructions next to the register state the following: For all purchases less than $400 ask, “Would you like to put this on your Barnes preferred customer card?” What is the most likely reason for these instructions?
answer_content: “To keep credit charges from the bank low” is the correct answer.

choice.b: To get customers to join the preferred customer program

choice.b: Yes, because the bar graph identifies the exposure time permitted without the use of hearing protection.

question_content: Q. Looking at both charts closely, what do the line and colored data point represent?

choice.a: The line represents the day. The data point represents the high.

choice.b: The line represents the day. The data point represents the low.

choice.c:
The line represents the high and low for the day. The data point represents the close.

Hint

See the on-page instruction for help!

question_content: Q. Which of the following best explains the tight cluster of data between 7/4/2017 and 7/18/2017 in Stock 1?

choice.a: The high and low varied greatly but the close remained the same from day to day.

choice.b: The high and low remained the same but the close varied greatly from day to day.

choice.c:
The high, low and close varied little from day to day.

Hint

See the on-page instruction for help!

question_content: Q. What is a possible explanation for how Stock 2 is trending between 6/20/2017 and 7/18/2017?

choice.a: Shareholder confidence in stock performance is increasing, which reflects in the increasing price.

choice.b: Shareholder uncertainty in stock performance is decreasing, which reflects in the decreasing price.

choice.c:
Shareholder uncertainty in stock performance is decreasing, which reflects in the steady price.

Hint

See the on-page instruction for help!

question_content: Q. In both charts, Stock A and Stock B show days in which the box is longer than those in other days. This is then followed by a jump in stock price. Which of the following correctly describes what happened in these boxes?

choice.a: The stock closed higher than it opened and its value went down.

choice.b: The stock closed higher than it opened and its value went up.

choice.c:
The stock closed lower than it opened and its value went up.

Hint

See the on-page instruction for help!

question_content: Q. Stock market numbers are recorded every day the stock market is open. What most likely explains the gaps in data during the weeks of 5/25/2017 and 6/1/2017?

choice.a: The stock market was closed on certain days.

choice.b: The stock market reporters forgot to record data for both stocks during gap days.

choice.c:
Both stocks experienced no change from the previous recording days.

Hint

Stock market numbers are recorded every day the stock market is open.

question_content: Q. According to this chart, during which month did the Share Volume reach an all time high while the Daily Closing Price reached an all time low over the shown period?

choice.d:
July 2017

Hint

See the on-page instruction for help!

question_content: Q. The pie chart below shows what the company spent on office supplies. What is wrong with this graphic?

choice.a: The graphic shows printer cartridges at 45%.

choice.c: The graphic shows data that adds up to more than 100%.

choice.d:
The graphic shows a larger percentage spent on file folders than on envelopes.

Hint

Pie chart data shows parts of the whole. Use the percentage data in the chart to select the answer.

question_content: Q. This graphics below show sales of laptops, desktops, and tablets over three years. If you want to see sale increases and decreases for each quarter, which type of graphic would you select to best communicate the data?

choice.a: A line chart because it clearly shows peaks and dips in sales over time.

choice.b:
A scatter plot because it shows individual data points for each quarter.

Hint

Select the graphic that shows what happens between the data points.

question_content: Q. If you want a graphic that allows you to see how much the different types of interest rate earnings add up to for each deal, which chart shown below is the best type of chart to use?

choice.d:
Area Chart

Hint

One graphic adds the data for you.

question_content: Q. These two line graphs present the same data yet one shows a rapid drop and the other shows a more gradual drop. Comparing the graphs, which statement explains why the information appears to be different?

choice.a: The x-axis was manipulated to show stocks for different companies.

choice.b: The y-axis was manipulated to show a different range in prices.

choice.c: The x-axis was manipulated to show different days of the week.

choice.d:
The y-axis was manipulated to show different currencies.

Hint

Study each graphic to find the difference.

question_content: Q. A startup company is tracking how many website visits they receive each month compared to how much money they spend on advertising. How many months did the number of website visits exceed 50,000 in both 2015 and 2016?

choice.d:
5 months

Hint

Find 50,000 on the left y-axis. Then find where both bars on the x-axis are higher than that number.

question_content: Q. During which months did the company spend exactly $4,000 on advertising?

choice.d:
Aug, Sep

Hint

Find $4,000 on the right y-axis. Then find the number of times the line chart intersects with that line at each month.

question_content: Q. You are in charge of managing freight shipments within the Tristate territory for a freight forwarding company. Based on the information in the graph, which of the following statements is true?

choice.a: The percentage of delays increased significantly from 16-Mar to 16-Aug.

choice.b: The number of shipments remained the same from 16-Jan to 16-Dec.

choice.c: There is a general correlation between the number of shipments and percentage of delays.

choice.d:
There was no difference in the percentage of on time shipments in the first half of the year.

Hint

Compare the information given in the bar chart and line graph to find the answer.

question_content: Q. During what month is the number of shipments highest?

choice.d:
16-Dec

Hint

Follow the direction of the line graph. Find where the line peaks to the highest point.

question_content: Q. What is the percentage of on time shipments in 16-Dec?

choice.d:
4500

Hint

Find the on time shipments bar in the 16-Dec column. Then find where it intersects with the y-axis.

question_content: Q. During which consecutive months does the number of shipments change the least?

choice.d:
16-Oct and 16-Nov

Hint

Use the line graph and number of shipments in the table to find the answer.

question_content: Q. This is a schematic diagram mechanics use to understand the flow of water in a car's coolant system. Using the diagram, where does the cooled water (blue) from the radiator travel to first?

choice.d:
To the mixing manifold.

Hint

Find the radiator. Then follow the direction of the arrows to the next location.

question_content: Q. What happens inside the radiator?

choice.d:
Heated and cooled water evaporate.

Hint

Look closely at the direction of the arrows on the diagram.

question_content: Q. This schematic diagram shows a refrigeration process. In the diagram, which of the following best describes the method by which the substance is being cooled?

choice.a: The substance is cooled by a jacketed cooler.

choice.b: The substance combines with the refrigerant.

choice.c: The substance filters through the compressor.

choice.d:
The substance is pumped through the heat exchanger.

Hint

The refrigerant is light blue and the substance is pink.

question_content: Q. What moves the refrigerant from the heat exchanger through the jacketed cooler?

choice.d:
The pump

Hint

Locate the step in the process that is in between the heat exchanger and the jacketed cooler.

question_content: Q. The diagram above shows the flow of power supply from the generating station to the end-use customer. If a secondary distribution customer were to receive electricity, which of the following correctly describes the electrical flow from the generating station?

choice.a: Electricity goes through the generating step-down transformer, then through the substation step-down transformer.

choice.b: Electricity goes through the generating step-up transformer, then through the substation step-up transformer.

choice.c:
Electricity goes through the generating step-up transformer, then through the substation step-down transformer.

Hint

Transmission lines are high capacity power lines that leave the generating station and go through a step—up transformer. Distribution lines are lower capacity power lines that go through a step—down transformer to power homes and businesses.

question_content: Q. Different voltage levels are supplied to different customer types. For example, the high voltage carried by a transmission line ranges from 60kV—500kV. According to the diagram, what level of voltage does a transmission customer receive?

choice.d:
120V and 240V

Hint

Transmission lines supply higher voltages to customers.

question_content: Q. The tables and chart are from an actual residential power bill. They show energy usage (in kilowatts) and costs. During which two months is the bill the highest without the customer exceeding the average usage of kWh energy usage over the last 13 months?

choice.d:
16-Oct and 16-Dec

Hint

Use the bar chart or the detailed energy usage table to find the answer.

question_content: Q. According to the Power Line Zone Classifications table, within which distance from a power line would a Rocky Mountain Juniper require removal?

choice.d:
50'

Hint

Use the Power Line Zone Classifications table and tree table to find the correct answer.

question_content: Q. Imagine that you are a landscape designer planning a map of trees and shrubs for a residential client. The client lives approximately 70' from a typical transmission line (blue) on the Eastern side of the house, and 50' from distribution lines (red) on the other sides. Tree D, located in the northwest corner of the map, is a Montmorency Cherry. What distance from the closest distribution line should Tree D be planted so that the tree is at the maximum recommended distance from the lines when its branches have grown to their greatest possible width?

choice.a: 6' from the center of the tree

choice.b: 12' from the center of the tree

choice.c: 27.5' from the center of the tree

choice.d:
40' from the center of the tree

Hint

Add half of the maximum tree width and maximum distance in the table to find the answer.

question_content: Q. This table shows quantities of tee-shirt styles being shipped to different regions. Which row contains the most units?

choice.d:
Row 6

Scan the left side of the table to find the rows, then find the row with the highest number of units.

choice.d:
Column D

Scan the top of the table to find the units column.

question_content: Q. In which section of the table would you find information about the retail sales price?

choice.d:
Column F, Rows 3 through 6 only

Scan both the top and the left side of the table to identify the section.

Cyclone DW3

Find the product with the highest star rating.

product name.

question_content: Q. The VP of Sales wants to encourage and reward top sellers across the five sales regions. If the quarterly sales goal was $250,000, which regions exceeded the goal in at least three quarters?

choice.d:
All but Southeast

question_content: Q. How are sales trending over the quarters for the Northwest region?

choice.b: Sales increase but then sharply decrease.

Sales are decreasing gradually.

Find the bar representing the Northwest. Then identify the pattern of change over each quarter (x-axis).

question_content: Q. All of the following statements could possibly support the reason why sales in the Southeast region have decreased each quarter except…

choice.a: The advertising budget was cut each quarter.

choice.b: The market in the Southeast trusts a competitor's brand more.

choice.c: Five new stores have been added to double the region's profits.

The CEO decided to decrease support and pull resources from the region.

Hint

Choose the least likely option.

question_content: Q. This table shows budgeted Federal funds for agricultural research over a three-year period. It helps you identify trends and plan for resources within your department. Which agricultural research program shows the greatest percent increase in funding from 2014 to 2015?

choice.d:
Special Research Grants

Compare the percent change from 2014 to 2015.

question_content: Q. Which of the following trend statements is true?

choice.a: Funding for Cooperative State Research, Education and Extension Service has steadily increased from 2013 to 2015.

choice.b: Research on plant sciences decreased 14.6 percent from 2013 to 2015.

choice.c: The budget for Research on Human Nutrition will change more than the budget for the Natural Resources Conservation Service.

choice.d:
Homeland Security funding will increase slightly from 2013 to 2015.

Hint

Be sure to read column titles carefully.

question_content: Q. The decrease in the proposed 2015 budget for Cooperative State Research, Education and Extension Service is mainly due to a reduction in funding for:

choice.d:
Special Research Grants

Hint

Read the data in each row carefully.

question_content: Q. Which best describes the trend of total hours of support over the year?

choice.a: Hours of support decreased, then increased.

choice.b: Hours of support rose sharply over time.

choice.c:
Hours of support rose and fell a bit, but generally stayed the same.

Hint

Look carefully at the legend and graph to be sure that you're looking at the correct data.

question_content: Q. The overall hours of support stayed about the same, yet the customer satisfaction rose. Which type of support seems most closely positively correlated with customer satisfaction?

choice.c:
Phone support

Hint

Compare the length of the segments of the bars with increases in customer satisfaction. If the type of support is positively correlated with satisfaction, the satisfaction should get higher as the segments get longer.

question_content: Q. The graph shows customer satisfaction data from January - December, but includes support data for the following January. What prediction can you make about customer satisfaction in January of the new year?

choice.c:
Customer satisfaction will stay the same.

Hint

In the last question, you identified the type of support the most positively correlates with satisfaction. Does it rise or fall in January of the new year?

question_content: Q. Which of the following could best explain what happened in 2005?

choice.a: Mobile access in many Southeast Asian countries got cheaper.

choice.b: Wired broadband access in many Southeast Asian countries got more expensive.

choice.c:
Mobile access in many Southeast Asian countries got more expensive.

Hint

Look at what happens with each trend, and consider cause and effect.

question_content: Q. Select the name of the country which showed the most rapid growth in wired broadband internet access from 2006 - 2008.

choice.d: Cambodia

question_content: Q. Which statement best explains the trend of wired broadband access in Indonesia?

choice.a: As mobile access in Indonesia has gone up, so has wired broadband access.

choice.b: As mobile access in Indonesia went up, fewer people signed up for broadband access, and some people dropped their broadband access.

choice.c:
As wired broadband access has gone up in other countries in Southeast Asia, it's also gone up in Indonesia.

Hint

Compare the two graphs, as well as the data within each graph.

question_content: Q. Based on the trend that started at the beginning of 2014, which of the following predictions is most likely to occur in 2016?

choice.a: Wired broadband access in Vietnam will exceed mobile access in Indonesia.

choice.b: Thailand will have more wired broadband users than mobile users.

choice.c:
The number of mobile users in Thailand will exceed the number of mobile users in Vietnam.

Hint

Pay attention to the graphs' scales as you compare these trends.

question_content: Q. This bar graph shows the sale of fruit from three employees of Market Fresh Grocery. Which of the following elements is missing from the graph?

choice.d:
Y-Axis

Hint

This graph (or chart) needs a name that supports the data shown.

question_content: Q. You're working on a marketing report that requires city population and demographics data over several decades. Here's a bar graph that supports your work. What was the population of New York in 1990?

choice.d:
3.4 million

Hint

According to the legend, the year 1990, is shown in yellow. Find New York on the horizontal (x) axis. From the top of the yellow bar, go across to the vertical (y) axis and read the value listed.

question_content: Q. You are in charge of purchasing paper for the City of Fairfield. You want to show the mayor how much paper the city used in the past. Approximately how much more did the city budget for paper in 2015 than in 2011?

choice.d:
$1.7 Million

Hint

The amount spent in 2015 is $1.7 Million. The amount spent in 2011 is $1.5 Million. Compare the two to find the difference.

question_content: Q. According to the graph, for what 3-year period did the budget increase each year from the previous year?

choice.c:
2013, 2014, 2015

Hint

In this bar chart, the budget increased each year through 2014 however it is not clear if the budget increased in 2011, since the graph does not show the budget for the year before, 2010.

question_content: Q. This chart compares 3rd Quarter sales of powerboats over four years. Which model shows a continuous increase in production over time?

choice.d:
AquaTurbo

Hint

Look for the bars that increase in height year to year.

question_content: Q. This line graph compares sales for four companies over one year. Which company had the lowest sales in the 4th quarter?

choice.d:
Company D

Hint

To find the company with the lowest sales in the fourth quarter, look at which point is lowest on the graph for the 4th quarter. Then use the legend to determine which company is represented by that symbol.

question_content: Q. In which quarter did Company C have its highest sales?

choice.d:
Fourth quarter

Hint

To determine in which quarter Company C had the highest sales, first find the symbol representing Company C – the triangle. Then find the triangle that is highest on the graph. Determine which quarter corresponds to that point.

question_content: Q. This line graph compares the wages of two companies. During which year was the difference in the wages of the two companies the least?

choice.d:
2004

Hint

To determine which year the difference between the wages of the two companies was the least, look at the space between the lines on the graph.

question_content: Q. Based on the trend that began in 2003, which of the following can be assumed of Company ABC for 2006?

choice.a: The wages will continue to decrease.

choice.c: The wages will remain the same.

choice.d:
The wages will exceed those of Company XYZ.

Hint

Use only the information in the graph to identify a pattern and make an inferance about what will happen next.

question_content: Q. Looking at the Sporting Goods Sales pie charts, when did this store sell the most products?

choice.c:
Need more information

Hint

Both pie charts show relative values, therefore, you cannot tell which season sold more products.

question_content: Q. According to the chart, what happens when hires are greater than total separations?

choice.c:
The employment level remains the same.

Hint

Compare the three chart lines to find the answer.

question_content: Q. What happens when separations are greater than hires?

choice.c:
The employment level remains the same.

Hint

Compare the three chart lines to find the answer.

question_content: Q. Which of the following happened between January 2008 and November 2009?

choice.a: Separations fell while hires and employment rose.

choice.b: Separations outpaced hires and employment rose.

choice.c:
Separations outpaced hires and employment fell.

Hint

Compare the three chart lines to find the answer.

question_content: Q. Based on the chart, which of the following statements appears to be true?

choice.a: The hires and total separations lines tend to follow a similar pattern.

choice.b: The employment figures have no influence on hires.

choice.c:
The separation line increases when employment decreases.

Hint

Compare the three chart lines to find the answer.

question_content: Q. This website dashboard shows actual analytics data from a small retailer's online business. Using the combination chart, approximately how many months were revenues at or higher than $30,000 with 1,000 or fewer monthly site visit clicks?

choice.d:
6 months

Hint

Find $30,000 on the right y-axis, then pan across to find the number of months that sales exceeded it. Then, find the number of months monthly site visit clicks were below 1,000 on the left y-axis.

question_content: Q. The combination chart compares monthly website visits, link clicks, and revenue from site sales. Based on the chart and table below it, which channel would you predict is likely to grow the site's sales the most in the next three months?

choice.d:
Social Network Visits

Hint

Use the channel sessions column in the table to make your prediction.

question_content: Q. Based on the data in the combination chart, which of the following statements is true?

choice.a: Clicks are higher than revenue every month.

choice.b: There is a direct correlation between website visits and clicks.

choice.c:
Social Network has the highest goal completion.

Hint

Compare each of the points to find the correlation.

question_content: Q. Where is the best place on the form to record details about the items being purchased?

choice.d: Description

question_content: Q. Which of the following must the requestor include in the PO form?

choice.d:
Delivery instructions

Hint

question_content: Q. What is the purpose of this form?

choice.c:
To improve next year's event.

Read the form carefully to find its purpose.

Pie chart

October, binders

46%

Develop

question_content: Q. This is a flowchart for a design/build company that prides itself on a streamlined ordering process. What happens directly after the second deposit is received?

False

Deliver On-Time

question_content: Q. This flowchart shows a hierarchy of company roles. Who oversees the Accounting & Finance team?

HR

question_content: Q. The President & CEO directly oversees all of the following, except…

question_content: Q. The customer service department of a large furniture retailer uses this flowchart to handle complaints. Which shape indicates that a decision needs to be made?

Line

question_content: Q. What should the customer service representative do if the customer's complaint is considered to be at a high level of seriousness?

Send the complaint to Claims Assistance.

choice.c: The complainant is recorded as company feedback.

The customer is referred to Claims Assistance.

question_content: Q. How much is each tick mark worth in the pressure gauge pictured?

3.5

question_content:
This pressure gauge measures pounds per square inch. Up to how many pounds per square inch can it measure? _____ lbs per square inch

Hint

Find the maximum amount the indicator can point to on the gauge.
answer_content: Solution: The correct answer is 250 pounds per square inch.

question_content: Q. This gauge measures both pounds per square inch and kilograms per square centimeter. If the indicator were to point to 6.5 kilograms per square cm, approximately how many pounds per square inch would that equal?

choice.d:
92 lb/in2

Hint

Find the 6 on the outer gauge and compare it to the numbers on the inner gauge.

question_content: Q. In a project management workflow like this, information is read from left to right and top to bottom. In this view, the project starts with Marketing at the top and concludes with the Product Release & Roll Out at the bottom. It is also divided into phases (e.g. Marketing and Sales) and sub-phases (e.g. Schematic Designing and Influencer Preview). Which of the following statements best explains the reason why the information is organized this way?

choice.a: Each phase is more important than the sub-phases.

choice.b: Each phase can be done simultaneously.

choice.c:
Each phase is dependent upon the phase before it.

Hint

Make an inference about why the information in the chart is presented this way.

question_content: Q. According to the chart, design development happens in two phases. What is the difference between Phase 1 and Phase 2?

choice.b: Phase 2 is longer than Phase 1 and includes UX Pilot Testing.

choice.c:
Phase 2 is longer than Phase 1 and includes R&D Analysis.

Hint

Find both phases of Design Development. Then compare the two.

question_content: Q. If the market strategy phase is delayed, what immediate dependency (next phase) does the delay affect?

choice.c:
Sales

Hint

Use the chart and table to find the phase that follows Market Strategy.

question_content: Q. The Product Design & Development phases require at least two employee resources in order to stay on schedule and within budget. Each employee resource takes approximately the same amount of time to complete a phase. If the client wants the project done in two weeks with the lowest possible cost, which employee resource combination should you choose?

choice.c:
Product Designer #1 + Junior Designer

Hint

Find both phases of Design Development. Then compare the two.

question_content: Q. The marketing department at your company relies on analytic data like these to understand how effective their email campaigns are. The scatter plot shows which of the following types of relationships?

choice.d:
Weak Positive

See the on-page instruction for help!

question_content: Q. Based on the information in the scatter plot, which of the following numbers of emails sent led to the highest click rate percentage?

choice.d:
20+

Hint

Read the information on the x- and y-axis carefully. Then interpret the data and make a decision.

question_content: Q. From the highest dot to the lowest dot, which range of sends per month had the greatest range of campaign click rates associated with it?

choice.d:
15 to 20

Hint

See which value on the y-axis has the longest “stack” of scores.

question_content: Q. The company is assessing the relationship between employee training hours and customer satisfaction ratings. Each green dot graphs an employee according to their training hours and customer satisfaction rating. According to the chart, how does receiving 1 hour of training compare to receiving 3 hours of training?

choice.a: Customer satisfaction is higher for those with 1 training hour.

choice.b: Customer satisfaction is the same for 1 and 3 training hours.

choice.c:
Customer satisfaction is higher for those with 3 training hours

Hint

Find where the data points are clustered on the x-axis at 6 hours and at 9 hours.

question_content: Q. Based on the information in the scatter plot, is it possible to receive a perfect customer review score of 100 with 0 hours spent training?

choice.b:
No

Hint

Find where the data points reach 100 on the y-axis.

question_content: Q. What is a possible explanation for the low number of scores after 11+ hours of training?

choice.a: Most employees stop receiving training after 11 hours.

choice.b: Customer feedback only applies to employees who have trained for 11 hours or less.

choice.c:
After 11 hours of training employees forget what they learned.

Hint

Use the chart to find the answer. Evaluate what the green dots (each representing an employee) tell you.

question_content: Q. What does the orange line indicate?

choice.b: The path of a guided tour through the studio

choice.c:
The path of the clay as it is turned into a product

Hint

Look at the legend for information about the meaning of symbols.

question_content: Q. Where is the finished pottery packed?

choice.d: Packing Room

question_content: Q. What comes directly after working in the glazing and finishing area?

choice.c: Taking the pottery to the kiln room

choice.d:
Packing the pottery in the packing room

The sequence of steps is shown with the orange line.

question_content: Q. If you entered the pottery studio through the double doors, what would you see directly in front of you?

choice.d:
The sinks

If you don't remember the symbol for double doors, look at the lesson text.

question_content: Q. Which of the following conclusions is supported by this graph?

choice.a: In 2016, most projects required 41-70 hours spent fixing bugs.

choice.b: In 2016, most projects required 0-40 hours spent fixing bugs.

choice.c:
In 2016, most projects required 71-80+ hours spent fixing bugs.

Hint

Each “area” in this chart shows a distribution of hours worked on various projects. The lower a point on the area is, the smaller number of projects were worked on for that many hours.

question_content: Q. Imagine that in 2017, the software development team hired a group of experienced developers to take over the most difficult projects. Which of these predictions is most likely?

choice.a: The 2017 area will be further to the right than the 2016 area.

choice.b: The 2017 area will be further to the left than the 2016 area.

choice.c:
The 2017 area will show no change from the 2016 area.

Hint

Each “area” in this chart shows a distribution of hours worked on various projects. Look at the difference between the two years before making your prediction about 2017.

question_content: Q. What were the greatest and smallest expenses for the product launch event, respectively?

choice.c:
Budget and Remaining Funds

Hint

The length of the bars shows their value. Their position shows the ongoing difference as values are subtracted from the original amount.

question_content: Q. Imagine you planned this event. Your boss said that you would get a small bonus if the event was more than $200 under budget. Will you receive the bonus?

choice.b: No, the event was over budget

choice.c:
No, the event was under budget by less than $200

Hint

The red columns represent the money spent. After all the money spent has been subtracted, you can see how much is left.

question_content: Q. Look at the chart for Grayson C. In which category did he show the most improvement from the mid-year review to the final review?

choice.d: Accuracy of Work

question_content: Q. Both of these employees were put on probation for poor performance. If an employee scores at least “3” in all categories, they will be removed from probation. Which employee can be removed from probation?

choice.d:
Neither

Hint

To read a radar chart, measure each point against the line it touches. Remember that the values are lowest at the center and highest at the edges of the graph.

question_content: Q. Based on the information given in this hybrid battery dashboard, which mode is the battery currently in?

choice.c:
CHG

Hint

Search the dashboard for the word “mode” to find the answer.

question_content: Q. The Check Transaxle light will flash if the transmission fluid temperature (TFT) rises above 300 degrees Fahrenheit or if other sensor inputs are triggered. Where in the owner's manual can you learn more about the transaxle for this vehicle?

choice.c:
Page 136

Hint

Compare the warning light on the digital dashboard with the corresponding symbol instruction in the owner's manual.

question_content: Q. Your company's mail room digital dashboard processes the mail and calculates the funds (money) available. The current amount of funds available is $2036.65. What will happen to the funds when the next envelope or package is stamped and processed?

choice.b: Available funds will remain the same.

choice.c:
Available funds will decrease.

Hint

Funds Available indicates the amount of money the company has for mail going out. This is like a checking account earmarked for one specific purpose. When the money is spent, the number goes down.

question_content: Q. The highlighted button shows an icon of a ribbon around an index finger. This signals the machine to remember something specific. What is the most likely use for this symbol on the dashboard?

choice.b: To save the settings for future mailings.

choice.c:
To call the service provider for maintenance.

Hint

This function is useful because it saves time for the person using the machine.

question_content: Q. The memo provides instruction for what happens if the seal is broken or the package is damaged. To whom is this memo directed?

choice.d:
The delivery truck driver

Hint

This is the person who typically signs for a package.

question_content: Q. You work for a bank that relies on federal funds rates as an important benchmark for loan decisions. This table shows the federal funds forecast from June 2015 to June 2017. Which month and year had the second highest number of responses?

choice.d:
Jun-17

Locate the Responses row on the table. Then find the column in which the second highest response exists.

question_content: Q. The “High” rate is important for the company's investment strategy. What is the lowest “High” rate over the period?

choice.d:
2.50

question_content:
Q. What was the average Federal Funds Rate in June 2016? The rate was _____.

Q. In which row would you find three cells with the same value?

Mode

Analyze each row to see which contains three cells of the same value.

question_content: Q. Which of the following is the most likely assumption based on the current trend for High rates?

choice.a: The High for Dec-17 will be 4.40.

choice.b: The High for Dec-17 will decrease by a full point.

choice.c: The 2018 Federal Funds rates will show more volatility.

Bank interest rates will plateau.

Use the information in the table to make a prediction.

12 times

choice.c: Training sessions last a maximum of 8 hours and 2 minutes.

question_content: What was the amount of the June electric bill?

question_content: The Barnes store manager prefers that customers use the Barnes preferred customer credit card for most purchases. In which case, would the manager prefer customers use their MCVS credit card?
answer_content: The correct answer is “When the purchase is greater than $400.00.”

choice.a: When the purchase is less than $100.00

choice.b: When the purchase is less than $150.00

choice.c: When the purchase is greater than $300.00

choice.d: When the purchase is greater than $400.00

question_content: For either credit card, based on the graphic, why would the store manager prefer customers make large purchases?
answer_content: The correct answer is “To decrease the interest charged to the store.”

choice.c: To decrease the interest charged to the store

choice.d: To increase the visibility of the store

question_content: Based on the table, what is the advantage for using 16-inch spacing compared to 24-inch spacing?
answer_content: The correct answer is “At a given load, the 16-inch spacing can support a larger span.”

choice.a: At a given load, the 16-inch spacing can support a smaller span

choice.b: At a given load, the 16-inch spacing can support a larger span

choice.c: At a given load, the 16-inch spacing requires less construction time

choice.d: At a given load, the 16-inch spacing requires less construction costs

question_content: The load requirement in your plan is 60 psf at a joist spacing of 16 inches. If the room dimensions are length 13 feet 2 inches and width 11 feet 7 inches, are 2×10 boards appropriate?
answer_content: The correct answer is “Yes, because 2 x 10 boards support the width and length of the room.”

choice.a: Yes, because 2 x 10 boards can support the width and length of the room

choice.b: Yes, because 2 x 10 boards support the 70 psf

choice.c: No, because 2 x 10 boards can support only the width of the room

choice.d: No, because the 2 x 10 boards can support neither the width nor length of the room

question_content: If you continue operating the tractor at its current level, how many acres can you expect to fertilize in the next hour?

choice.d: 19.87 acres

question_content: Shifting into first gear generally increases the engine speed (rpm) while decreasing the tractor speed (mph). What would be the effect of this change?
answer_content: The correct answer is “Area rate would decrease, and flow rate would increase.”

choice.a: Both area rate and flow rate would increase.

choice.b: Area rate would increase, and flow rate would decrease.

choice.c: Area rate would decrease, and flow rate would increase.

choice.d: Both area rate and flow rate would decrease.

question_content: The soil samples for the next field indicate that fertilizer coverage needs to be greater. To achieve this, you need to increase flow rate. How would you achieve this?
answer_content: The correct answer is “Increase the engine speed to approximately 2,000 rpm.”

choice.a: Increase speed to approximately 7.1 mph so that you cover the field more quickly

choice.b: Increase the engine speed to approximately 2,000 rpm

choice.c: Decrease speed to approximately 6.0 mph so that you cover the field more slowly

choice.d: Shift to second gear so that the engine speed slows

question_content: What is the approximate percentage of observed faults during all four phases that were logic faults?

You have been directed to trim $10,000 from the monthly warehouse expenses. You are also told that you cannot reduce the costs for HVAC, refrigeration, and lights. Given this, which expense must be cut significantly?

choice.d: Lights

question_content: The cogeneration plant institutes a policy that no one may work more than eight hours per day. As a result, which of the following statements is consistent with the 8-hour day policy?
answer_content: The correct answer is “Only workers in the Fuel Gas Compressor House, the Turbine Generator Module, near the Boiler, and in the Work Area must wear hearing protection.”

choice.a: Only workers in the Fuel Gas Compressor House, the Turbine Generator Module, near the Boiler, and in the Work Area must wear hearing protection

choice.b: Only workers in the Fuel Gas Compressor House, the Control Room, and the Demineralizer Station must wear hearing protection

choice.c: Only workers in the Turbine Generator Module, Acid Caustic area, near the Boiler, and in the Work Area must wear hearing protection

choice.d: All indoor workers will need to wear hearing protection, but outdoor workers must wear hearing protection

question_content: You are asked to make a graph that illustrates the percentage differences by age group for one year. Which of these graphs best meets your goal?
answer_content: is the correct answer.
